# Hardshrink

`class torch.nn.Hardshrink(lambd=0.5)` [source]

    
Applies the Hard Shrinkage (Hardshrink) function element-wise.

Hardshrink is defined as:

HardShrink(x)={x, if x>λx, if x<−λ0, otherwise \text{HardShrink}(x) =
\begin{cases} x, & \text{ if } x > \lambda \\\ x, & \text{ if } x < -\lambda
\\\ 0, & \text{ otherwise } \end{cases}

Parameters

    
lambd (float) – the λ\lambda value for the Hardshrink formulation. Default:
0.5

Shape:

    
  * Input: (∗)(*), where ∗* means any number of dimensions.
  * Output: (∗)(*), same shape as the input.

![../_images/Hardshrink.png](data:image/png;base64,)

Examples:

    
    >>> m = nn.Hardshrink()
    >>> input = torch.randn(2)
    >>> output = m(input)
